summary: FBI interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons guard regarding his knowledge of procedures and the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody. The guard indicates that Epstein was a known high-profile inmate requiring special attention and makes a comment suggesting lapses in guard duties on the day of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC); the interview concerns the circumstances around his death.

persons.name: EMPLOYEE 2
persons.context: BOP guard interviewed about prison procedures and his knowledge of events related to Epstein's death. He states he was told to keep an eye on Epstein.

persons.name: NOEL
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a question about whether rounds were not being done; appears to be a guard assigned to Epstein's unit.

persons.name: THOMAS
persons.context: Mentioned alongside NOEL in a question about whether rounds were not being done; appears to be a guard assigned to Epstein's unit.

connections.description: EMPLOYEE 2 was a BOP guard who was told by supervisors to keep an eye on Epstein due to his high-profile status.
Both are guards mentioned together in the context of questions about whether rounds were performed.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: EMPLOYEE 2 Last Worked in SHU
events.description: The last time EMPLOYEE 2 worked in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) prior to Epstein's death.

events.title: FBI Interview of EMPLOYEE 2
events.description: FBI, OIG, and SDNY AUSAs interview BOP guard EMPLOYEE 2 regarding prison procedures and the circumstances of Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: A BOP guard (EMPLOYEE 2) stated that 'everybody knew the deal' with Epstein and that he was specifically told by guards and supervisors to keep an eye on him.

EMPLOYEE 2, who was not working in the SHU on the day of Epstein's death, commented, 'Thank God I wasn't working (SHU), would not happen if i was there, I do my rounds,' implying potential lapses in guard duties.
The interview specifically questioned whether guards NOEL and THOMAS failed to perform their rounds, but EMPLOYEE 2 replied 'no' to having direct knowledge of that.
The document is an FBI 302 form recording an official interview conducted as part of the investigation into Epstein's death in custody.
